-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                                 Release Notes
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Episode 1 - Enemies screenplay 
Original Air Date: June 29, 2001
The SG-1 team, in their stolen Goa\&#039;uld mothership, has arrived 125 years travel 
from Earth. Shortly after their arrival, Apophis\&#039; mothership arrives, carrying 
Teal\&#039;c, who was shot with a staff weapon, and is presumed dead. As Apophis 
begins to attack, an unknown third ship arrives. (Part 2 of 2).

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Episode 2 - Threshold screenplay 
Original Air Date: July 6, 2001
His mind altered by Apophis, Teal\&#039;c must undergo an ancient ritual that takes 
him to the edge of death itself, in order for him to rediscover who he is. 
With assistance from Bra\&#039;tac, Teal\&#039;c is forced to relive several episodes from 
his life, from when he was still loyal to Apophis.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Episode 3 - Ascension screenplay 
Original Air Date: July 13, 2001
After arriving on an alien planet for a routine mission, Carter passes out for 
no apparent reason. After returning to Earth, she takes some time away from 
the SGC, and finds herself in the company of a strange new friend. Guest 
starring Sean Patrick Flanery and John de Lancie.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Episode 4 - The Fifth Man screenplay 
Original Air Date: July 20, 2001
Colonel O\&#039;Neill and Lieutenant Tyler are ambushed by Goa\&#039;uld forces and 
trapped behind enemy lines, fighting a new Jaffa faction under an unknown 
System Lord. Meanwhile, the rest of SG-1 discover that they don\&#039;t know who 
Lieutenant Tyler is. Guest starring Dion Johnstone and John de Lancie

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
